result.execSummary:
The defendant Jeffrey A Knope was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting/Failing to Stop/Fleeing, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(2t).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Bond amount posted shall be applied and balance applied to 14TR632.

With Huber privileges consistent with the rules of the jail while the inmate maintains a minimum security status. The defendant, at the discretion of the Sheriff, may perform community service work as an inmate worker in the county jail and shall earn statutory good time for same.
Per order of the Court on 9-16-14, Defendant shall receive two days sentence credit.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jeffrey A Knope

Washington County Sheriff's Department Jail Disposition of Prisoners
Disposition Form
Letter received from Atty Schepper

Def in person & by Atty William Andrew Mayer.  Atty Mandy A. Schepper appeared for State.  State moves to amend Ct. 1 to misd. failure to stop for a traffic officer pursuant to sec. 346.04(2)(t).  Court requests further explanation as to amendment; statements by counsel.  Court grants amendment to Ct. 1.  Guilty plea entered on amended Ct. 1.   Court finds def guilty on amended Ct. 1.  Argument by counsel.  Court proceeds to sentencing.

7-30-14 Hearing rescheduled to 8-01-14 at 9:30 a.m. per request of Atty. William Mayer to allow further pretrial with DA; no objection from DA.  DA notified via email by Judge's clerk; no written notice given.
Plea hearing on July 30, 2014 at 10:00 am.

Def in person & by Atty William A Mayer.  Atty Mark D Bensen appeared for State.  Defense withdraws motion.  Adjourned to allow ongoing negotiations.  Plea hearing scheduled for July 30, 2014 at 10:00 am.

(Citation as well) Def given complaint, advised of charges, penalties and rights, and probable cause found.  State rqst. some cash bond.  Counsel rqst. signature bond.
